radiographic_examinations.findings: A well-defined, noncystic lesion, measuring 4.5 cm in diameter, originating from the inferomedial aspect of the right side of the liver.
A well-defined, noncystic lesion, measuring 4.5 cm in diameter, originating from the inferomedial aspect of the right side of the liver.
The lesion appeared as an exophytic mass that did not contain fat, did not enhance on arterial phase, and did not show delayed uptake of gadoxetate.
Diffuse, intensely hypermetabolic lymph nodes, but the hepatic mass was not hypermetabolic.
Focal uptake in the inferior right hepatic lobe and the left upper abdomen, consistent with both intrahepatic splenosis and a residual splenule.
